Description: For each leak event, the time from leak detection to moisture returning to baseline at that location estimates the drying time.
short rationale: Event timelines per location; moderate location sensitivity.

Description: If leak history shows no new leaks at a location but moisture remains elevated for days, residual dampness is present.
short rationale: Shows lingering moisture at specific spots; moderate location/timeline exposure.

Description: Locations with repeated moisture spikes but no corresponding leak events in history are probable hidden or undetected leaks.
short rationale: Reveals unlogged leaks at specific locations; notable location sensitivity.

Description: Leak events that are never followed by any measurable moisture change around them are likely false positives or dry anomalies.
short rationale: Flags false leak records; low privacy beyond timestamps.

Inference: Leak severity estimation from moisture profile
Description: For each leak, the peak moisture level and the duration above a threshold from logs provide a severity score for that leak event.
short rationale: Per-incident severity with timing; supports detailed reconstruction.

Description: Combine number of leaks at a location with total time that moisture stayed above a critical level there to estimate damage potential.
short rationale: Aggregates severity and duration per location; location/history sensitivity.

Inference: Water spread radius from each leak
Description: After a leak event, the set of moisture sensors that show rising values and their distances from the leak location give a spread radius.
short rationale: Maps spread across sensors; high location and layout exposure.

Description: Compare, for similar-sized leaks, how quickly moisture decays at different locations to assess drainage efficiency.
short rationale: Compares drying across zones; moderate location sensitivity.

Inference: Leak location refinement using moisture peaks
Description: When the leak event is logged at coarse resolution, the sensor with the earliest and strongest moisture rise indicates the likely exact leak point.
short rationale: Pinpoints origin using earliest peak; high location specificity.

Inference: Distinguishing plumbing leaks from surface events
Description: Sustained leak entries with repeated moisture spikes at plumbing spots indicate plumbing leaks, while moisture spikes without leaks suggest surface water sources.
short rationale: Differentiates cause with location context; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Response delay impact on moisture damage
Description: For each leak, comparing the time from detection to peak moisture level reveals how intervention delay affects severity.
short rationale: Incident timelines for mitigation speed; moderate reconstruction risk.

Description: Locations that repeatedly show the pattern ‘leak event → moisture spike → slow drying’ are recurrent failure sites.
short rationale: Marks recurrent problem sites; location/history exposure.

Description: Multiple small leak events with separate moisture peaks suggest intermittent failures; one leak event with a long moisture plateau suggests a continuous leak.
short rationale: Behavior classification per location; moderate detail.

Description: Rank locations using both leak frequency and average or total moisture-above-threshold time to prioritize maintenance.
short rationale: Ranking of zones by leak/moisture history; location-sensitive.

Description: At some locations, leak events cluster in certain seasons and those leaks also exhibit longer moisture persistence during those periods.
short rationale: Seasonal patterns tied to locations; moderate sensitivity.

Description: Leak events near the floor followed by delayed moisture increases in higher-mounted sensors indicate capillary rise through materials.
short rationale: Reveals vertical water movement; location and timing sensitive.

Description: Small leak events that yield large or delayed moisture footprints at non-adjacent sensors imply water accumulation in hidden cavities.
short rationale: Suggests hidden pathways/cavities; location and timing exposure.

Description: For leaks of similar size, locations where moisture decays slowly indicate more porous materials; fast decay indicates less porous surfaces.
short rationale: Material characteristics per zone; moderate location sensitivity.

Description: Areas where moisture repeatedly spikes without any leak events, while nearby zones show both, indicate gaps in leak sensor coverage or sensitivity.
short rationale: Highlights coverage gaps by location; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Distinguishing one large leak from many small leaks
Description: A single leak event associated with a long continuous moisture plateau differs from multiple shorter moisture peaks tied to separate leak records.
short rationale: Classifies leak pattern; moderate incident specificity.

Description: Before vs. after remediation, comparing leak frequency and moisture decay times at the same locations shows whether fixes were effective.
short rationale: Pre/post maintenance evaluation per location; moderate timeline exposure.

Inference: Leakage pathway consistency over multiple events
Description: If different leak events in the same area produce similar spatial patterns of moisture activation, that pattern reveals a stable water pathway.
short rationale: Stable pathway mapping; location/layout sensitive.

Description: When leak detection triggers only at a threshold, the first detectable rise in moisture can infer an earlier approximate leak start time.
short rationale: Adjusts start time using moisture rise; moderate event detail.

Description: A leak event at one location combined with moisture rising first downstream indicates that the leak origin may be upstream of the logged point.
short rationale: Infers origin relative to sensors; location-sensitive.

Description: If most locations show leaks accompanied by moisture changes but one sensor repeatedly shows only leaks or only moisture, that sensor may be faulty.
short rationale: Sensor diagnostics; low personal exposure.

Description: Comparing moisture duration for leaks during likely absence vs. presence shows that unattended leaks typically cause longer wet periods.
short rationale: Links damage duration to occupancy/presence; higher behavioral sensitivity.

Description: Leaks detected early show shallower and shorter moisture profiles, while late-detected leaks show higher peaks and longer durations.
short rationale: Evaluates detection timing vs. severity; moderate incident exposure.

Inference: Differentiating first-time vs. chronic problem zones
Description: Locations with a single leak and normal moisture behavior differ from locations with many leaks and increasingly slower drying after each one.
short rationale: Distinguishes one-off vs. chronic zones; location/history sensitive.
